div.script: (function($){function shuffle(arr) {for (var j, x, i = arr.length; i;j = parseInt(Math.random() * i),x = arr[--i], arr[i] = arr[j], arr[j] = x);return arr;}var cnt = 0, $mastheads = $("#mastheads");var imgs = ["/pages/mastheads/DJI_0089.JPG","/pages/mastheads/DSC_0221.JPG","/pages/mastheads/DSC_2216.JPG","/pages/mastheads/DSC_2265.JPG","/pages/mastheads/DSC_4785.JPG"];var links = [];if (imgs.length > 10) cnt = 10; else cnt = imgs.length; for (var i=0; i<cnt; i++) {if (links[i]) {$mastheads.append('<\/a>');} else {$mastheads.append('');}}$(function() {if ($mastheads.length) {$mastheads.nivoSlider({effect: 'boxRainReverse',slices: 30,boxCols: 8,boxRows: 4,animSpeed: 500,pauseTime: 3000,directionNav: 0,controlNav: 0,keyboardNav: 0,pauseOnHover: 1});}});})(jQuery);

img.alt: Punjabi Lessons Online | Punjabi Tutors | Language Courses

span.strong: Woodlawn High School Title I Remote Learning

span.span: Woodlawn High School offers Title I Services to all students and these services are funded through federal grants. Ordinarily, students can take advantage of these services by attending tutoring sessions with Mrs. Hodge during study hall and/or after school on Tuesdays and Thursdays. Mrs. Hodge is still available during this remote learning process. If interested, you may email Mrs. Hodge at khodge@woodlawnschools.org with your questions or to request a live individual video session appointment.

a.aria-label: Read more about WHS - Title I Remote Learning

h3.a: WHS Prom - Date Changed to July 4th

span.span:
Saturday, July 4th
7:00-11:00 p.m.
A Fair Barn - Salem, IL
Tickets are priced at $25/person. This includes appetizers, photobooth, a t-shirt, and possibly fireworks!
Watch the school website and Facebook for details on ticket sales closer to the event.

a.aria-label: Read more about WHS Prom - Date Changed to July 4th

div.p: Listed below are scholarship opportunities available to high school seniors. For more information, see Mrs. Witzel.

tr.td: Must have a parent or grandparent that is a member of the legion post.
Students who plan to pursue a bachelor's degree in nursing
Relationship between student's family and the Kaskaskia Valley Credit Union.
WHS Senior planning to further their education
Any student taking classes towards a degree/certification
Any Jefferson Co. HS Student attending college directly after high school

Jefferson County high school senior; planning to enter the healthcare field.
Scholarship Evaluation Form

a.aria-label: Read more about Scholarships - For Seniors

span.img: Well, this is definitely a year that we don't want to forget! Be sure to order your 2019-2020 WHS Yearbook by completing the form and mailing to or dropping off at WHS. Checks payable to Woodlawn High School. Mailing address: 300 North Central Lane, Woodlawn, IL 62898. Questions or concerns? Contact Matt Smith at mattsmith@woodlawnschools.org or Kelly Owens at kowens@woodlawnschools.org. Deadline extended to April 24th.

a.aria-label: Read more about WHS - Order Your Yearbook!

span.span: In an effort to continue educational services while students are at home, Woodlawn #209 has developed a Remote Learning Plan. Documents related to this plan are listed below. If you have any questions, contact the appropriate person on the Contacts page. Thank you for being a supportive school community during this time.

a.aria-label: Read more about Remote Learning Plan

h3.a: Woodlawn 209 - Google Drive (Access to Files During School Closure)

img.alt: Download Pencil Category Png, Clipart and Icons | FreePngClipart

span.span: Woodlawn #209 (including Woodlawn Grade School and Woodlawn High School) has created a Google Drive for parents and students to access. This drive contains files/assignments for many of the classes.
If you have specific questions about homework or assignments, please contact the teacher via email.

a.aria-label: Read more about Woodlawn 209 - Google Drive (Access to Files During School Closure)

span.img: Due to the current regulations in our country surrounding COVID-19, Freshman Orientation is postponed for now. Once it is rescheduled, information will be shared as well as posted here on the school website.

span.span: If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact Mr. Helbig (ehelbig@woodlawnschools.org) or Mrs. Witzel (lwitzel@woodlawnschools.org).

Woodlawn High School is looking forward
to meeting the Class of 2024!

a.aria-label: Read more about WHS - Freshman Orientation

span.span: Woodlawn High School has published the 1st Quarter Honor Roll. Congratulations to all students!

a.aria-label: Read more about WHS - 3rd Quarter Honor Roll

span.span: If you plan to attend RLC, registration will be handled differently this spring. Because we won’t be able to do registration at WHS, they want seniors to make appointments via phone/teleconferencing. Please make an appointment to do this before April 10th if you want to get into classes before they are filled.

span.em: Mrs. Witzel has sent an email to all seniors with more detailed information and registration links.

a.aria-label: Read more about Rend Lake College - Registration

span.span: Message from Booster Club to WHS Seniors:

Hey WHS seniors... We are doing something a little different this year with Booster Club scholarships. They are being mailed to all qualifying seniors. YOU will be responsible for returning them to the address provided, with ALL the correct information, attachments and post marked on the date requested. Be on the look out in your mailbox for the forms. We will not accept any late postmarked scholarships--please make sure you notice that detail.

a.aria-label: Read more about Booster Club Scholarship

div.span: A 20 percent chance of showers before 4pm. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 63. Southwest wind around 5 mph becoming light and variable.
Mostly cloudy, then gradually becoming mostly clear, with a low around 40. Calm wind becoming north northwest around 5 mph after midnight.
Sunny, with a high near 65. Light and variable wind becoming west southwest 5 to 10 mph in the morning. Winds could gust as high as 18 mph.
